zombie.name: Patricia
zombie.backstory: Elementary school teacher for 25 years. Always the 'together' one - organized, energetic, everyone's rock. Then perimenopause hit at 47 and I became someone I didn't recognize. Hot flashes during parent conferences. Crying in the supply closet. Couldn't remember student names I'd known for years. My doctor said 'it's just hormones' and offered HRT but no real explanation. I felt so ALONE. Every woman I knew was suffering silently too.
zombie.dramaticMoment: My wake-up call was the 500th night waking up at 3am, sheets soaked, heart racing, crying because I thought this was just my life now. I was 49, exhausted, gaining weight no matter what I did, and my husband didn't understand why I was 'so emotional.' I googled 'is menopause supposed to be this bad' at 3:17am and found a hormone health coach. Within 8 weeks, I was sleeping through the night. I knew I had to help other women avoid suffering alone like I did.
zombie.transformation: From exhausted, hot-flashing, brain-fogged teacher counting down to retirement -> To certified hormone health coach making $5,000/month helping women THRIVE through menopause instead of just surviving it.
zombie.incomeStory: $5,000/month working 12 hours/week. Started with a free 'Menopause Support Circle' at my church. Now I have 10 regular clients and women find me through word of mouth. Still teaching part-time but transitioning fully to coaching by summer.

writingStyle.capitalization: mostly lowercase, strategic ALL CAPS for hormone struggles
writingStyle.punctuation: uses ... for dramatic pauses, dashes for asides, lots of parenthetical thoughts
writingStyle.tone: warmly relatable about hormone symptoms, normalizes the struggle, uses gentle humor about hot flashes and mood swings, motherly encouragement

zombie.videoTestimonialScript: Hi, I'm Patricia. Three years ago I was a teacher who couldn't get through a class without a hot flash. I was up every night at 3am, soaking wet, crying, wondering if this was just my life now. My doctor said it was 'normal' but it didn't feel normal. [PAUSE - emotional] When I found hormone health coaching, everything changed. I finally understood my body. Now I help other women skip the suffering I went through. Last month I made five thousand dollars working part-time. If you're watching this soaked in sweat at 3am like I was... there's hope. And you don't have to figure it out alone.
